statement: Klee has an array a of length n containing integers [k, k+1, ..., k+n-1] in that order. Klee wants to choose an index i (1 ≤q i ≤q n) such that x = |a_1 + a_2 + ... + a_i - a_{i+1} - ... - a_n| is minimized. Note that for an arbitrary integer z, |z| represents the absolute value of z. Output the minimum possible value of x.
input_specification: InputThe first line contains t (1 ≤q t ≤q 10^4) — the number of test cases.Each test case contains two integers n and k (2 ≤q n, k ≤q 10^9) — the length of the array and the starting element of the array.
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output the minimum value of x on a new line.
note:
In the first sample,
a=[2,3]
. When
i=1
is chosen,
x=|2−3|=1
. It can be shown this is the minimum possible value of
x
.
In the third sample,
a=[3,4,5,6,7]
. When
i=3
is chosen,
x=|3+4+5−6−7|=1
. It can be shown this is the minimum possible value of
x
.
